What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: Better reading, speaking and writing abilities.
It was really great being exposed to Russian short stories and authors.
I developed my essay writing skills, specifically in using high register formal language.

We read a lot of interesting short stories. One thing I could perhaps suggest is that we put more emphasis on the language aspect as opposed to the literature aspect (i.e. perhaps more talking by the students).
A good overall reading course; good overview of Russian literature.
Course was incredible, really improved my writing style and analytical skills.
The course covered a large amount of content and the discursive nature of class encouraged students to contribute their own ideas.
I would definitely recommend taking advanced language courses in Russian, as the topics they cover are much more interesting than topics covered in other language courses.
For sure. Friendly, interesting and low stress class.
Would absolutely recommend to another student.
Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. Julia Titus is absolutely the best Russian professor there is. She cares so much about all her students. Thank you!

The literature is cool (too many duels for my taste, though), but the professor is not a great discussion leader. Intimidating to talkI felt like the professor was always waiting for me to finish whenever I said anything.

This course is an excellent way to become familiar with Russian literature and some of its most famous authors. The four essays you write during the course of the semester help you to develop your formal writing skills greatly and facilitate a deeper analysis of the texts covered. I highly recommended this course for anyone interested in Russian literature or even Russian in general. Professor Titus is amazing and class will never not be fun and engaging.
